thread.title: European shares pull back but Tesco gains after strong update

title: European shares pull back but Tesco gains after strong update
text:
April 11, 2018 / 8:05 AM / Updated 12 minutes ago European shares pull back but Tesco gains after strong update Reuters Staff 2 Min Read 
MILAN (Reuters) - European shares fell slightly on Wednesday in a broad-based pullback as escalating tensions in Syria added to market worries, although solid results from Tesco ( TSCO.L ) and strength among telecoms stocks helped limit losses. The German share price index, DAX board, is seen at the stock exchange in Frankfurt, Germany, March 21, 2018. REUTERS/Tilman Blasshofer 
The pan-European STOXX 600 index fell 0.35 percent by 0715 GMT with most sectors trading in negative territory, while Germany's DAX .GDAXI and Britain's FTSE also slipped slightly following strong gains on Tuesday. 
Tesco was the top STOXX gainer, up 3.7 percent after the British retailer beat guidance with a 28 percent rise in full-year profit, underlining the recovery under CEO Dave Lewis. 
Deutsche Telekom ( DTEGn.DE ) rose 3.9 percent after reports that Sprint ( S.N ) had restarted talks to merge with the German groupâ€™s U.S. unit T-Mobile US Inc ( TMUS.O ). Its gains lifted the telecoms index .SXKP up 0.8 percent, making it the biggest sectoral gainer in Europe. 
Still in earnings, a solid update lifted shares in Swiss chocolate maker Barry Callebaut ( BARN.S ) up 2.6 percent, while CHR Hansen ( CHRH.CO ) fell 4 percent after it missed second-quarter profit forecasts. Reporting by Danilo Masoni, Editing by Helen Reid
